meanings.definition: To stop or slow down the progress of something.
meanings.sent1: Please check the speed of the car before it goes too fast.
meanings.sent2: I always check my watch to make sure I'm not late.
meanings.sent3: I tried to check time itself, but it kept moving forward.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a check on his anger, calming him instantly.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a bell to check the noisy classroom.

meanings.definition: A written order to a bank to pay a stated sum from the drawer's account.
meanings.sent1: He wrote a check to pay for his groceries at the store.
meanings.sent2: She received a check as a gift for her birthday.
meanings.sent3: The check danced in the wind as it fell from his pocket.
meanings.sent4: The check was like a magic ticket, granting access to anything.
meanings.sent5: The check had the power to turn paper into money.

meanings.definition: A mark indicating that something has been noted, verified, or completed.
meanings.sent1: The check on the paper showed it was approved.
meanings.sent2: He put a check next to each item on the list as he finished it.
meanings.sent3: The check winked at her, letting her know it was done.
meanings.sent4: The check was like a stamp of approval, making everything official.
meanings.sent5: The check was a bright sign that the task was finished.

meanings.definition: To examine or inspect something closely.
meanings.sent1: I need to check the ingredients before I eat this.
meanings.sent2: She always checks her work for mistakes before submitting it.
meanings.sent3: He tried to check the tiny ant with a magnifying glass.
meanings.sent4: The detective had to check every detail to solve the case.
meanings.sent5: She used a flashlight to check the dark corners of the room.
